name: Anna Lukina
content: Anna Lukina — computer scientist Skip to content I am computer scientist working on improving safety and interpretability of artificial intelligence and collaborating with researchers in the US, Europe, Japan, and Australia. I am leading a team designing algorithms inspired by formal methods with real-world applications spanning engineering, transportation, health, and finance. Take a look at our projects and publications. Learn about my career path in DerStandard: “Warum so wenige Frauen Den Code knacken wollen”. As part of my service, I lead several initiatives promoting junior computer scientists from underrepresented communities. More in my interview to the university magazine Delta. Assistant Professor, TU Delft The Netherlands Email DBLP Google Scholar ORCID arXiv GitHub LinkedIn Recent news 11/25: Sterre will contribute our perspective to the Dagstuhl Seminar on User-Aligned Assessment of AI Systems in January 2026. 10/25: I gave an invited talk and had an inspirational discussion within AI Fundamentals Seminar at EPFL. 9/25: I am a coordinator of ELLIS Delft Unit and ELSA EU cooperation. 8/25: Our new paper was presented by Sterre at IJCAI 2025!
